author: The Thirsty Otter

yeasts.description: This strain is a great choice for New England-style IPAs. It produces a medium-ester profile similar to WLP008 East Coast Ale Yeast and leaves some residual sweetness, which helps accentuate both malt and hop flavors and aromas.
yeasts.name: London Fog Ale

name: Hopalaa - Session Two (clone)

fermentables.notes: BEST Pilsner Malt gives beer a fresh and rounded taste. It is used for all types of beers based on basically barley malt. It forms an excellent “light” and enzyme-rich foundation for almost all beer styles. Malt characteristics: low protein levels, high extract content, light colour and high enzymatic activity.
fermentables.name: Pilsner

fermentables.usedIn: Wheat beers and adjunct for ales up to 40% of grist.
fermentables.notes: Head retention and lacing – dry biscuity flavour.
fermentables.name: Pale Wheat Malt

fermentables.notes:
Use in conjunction with base malt to get conversion.
These Flaked Oats are supplied mixed with the husk. This item will always be supplied as uncrushed. NOTE: If a recipe says you need 500 g of oats you will need to order 1000 g of this product due to the husk taking up nearly 50% of the volume.
fermentables.usedIn: Used to add body and mouth feel.
fermentables.name: Flaked Oats Including Husk
TMM Rolled Wheat Flakes
fermentables.usedIn: Belgian white beers, lambic, grand, but also in more modern New England styles of beer.
fermentables.notes: Wheat flakes traditionally used in Belgian white beers, lambic, but also in more modern New England styles of beer. Gives a fuller flavour and increases the head of your beer. Can be used up to 20-40% without too much problem. There is no need to select a crush on flaked wheat as we will always provide these whole and uncrushed.

notes:
Target: ABV = 4.9 %, IBU = 23, EBC = 9.
Malt is ordered with standard crush @ The Malt Miller (https://www.themaltmiller.co.uk/).

Can be used up to 20-40% without too much problem. There is no need to select a crush on flaked wheat as we will always provide these whole and uncrushed.

hops.name: Mosaic (T90)
hops.notes: New American variety bred from Simcoe and Nugget. Mosaic offers a blend of earthy, floral, tropical and fruity characteristics that work excellently in a variety of different beer styles.

hops.name: Sabro (HBC 438) (T90)
hops.notes:
Sister to the well-known experimental HBC 472, Sabro exhibits many of the same characteristics, such as the coconut aroma. It imparts a strong and complex fruit flavour to beer, and has been described as having a mango, grapefruit, lemon grass and wood aroma, as well as the unique coconut.
PEDIGREE
“Unique cross pollenatoin with female neomexicanus ”
RECOMMENDED BEER STYLES
American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, IPA, NEIPA, Porter, Stout
KEY FLAVOURS
Tangerine, coconut, tropical and stone fruit with hints of cedar
TOTAL OIL COMPOSITION
Alpha w/w – 12.0-16.0%
Beta w/w – 4-7%
Total Oils mls/100gm – 2.5-3.0
Cohumulone – 20-24% of alpha acids
Myrcene (of total oil) – 55-65%
Caryophyllene (of total oil) – 11-13%
Humulene (of total oil) – 8-10%
Farnesene (of total oil) – <1%
